climbs.name: Young Monkeys
climbs.fa: ?? if you know let me know.

content.description: Great moderate climbing up the prow.  Face climb up a seam to the 1st bolt.  Continue past 2 more bolts, then left into a crack system.  Follow the crack to a final headwall with a bolt to a belay ledge.
content.protection: quickdraws (4 bolts) wires and small to medium cams.  Bolts are Leper button heads as of 3/06.
content.location: Prow just right of the large crack on the left side of the formation.  Walk off.

climbs.name: Wimpy
climbs.fa: ?? if you know let me know.

content.description: The book that I have calls this route 5.8 but the start will tell you different.  Thin edging no pro 20' to a horizontal seam.  Climb crack above to bolt and then run it out.
content.protection: Quickdraws, Wires and small to medium cams
content.location: Just to the left of the large crack (the big one you saw on the way in ) on the left side of the formation.

climbs.name: Sweet Surprise
climbs.fa: ?? if you know let me know.

content.description: Climb the obvious crack on the right side of the formation.  Start up a fun triangular flake.  Above climb thin hands to a seam.  Belay on the ledge above with gear.
content.location: Obvous crack on the right side of the formation.

content.description: Flared hand crack in far left corner, just right of a cave, with lots of features for stem and chimney.
content.protection: Small tricams, small to large cams
content.location: Start 20 feet left of Shake n Bake, at a large hand crack with lots of features for stem and chimney, I exited to the right off the funky thin flake. Descend on class 3 ramp heading north next top the wall.

content.description: Start on the face just right of Sweet Surprise and climb the steep and challenging face past 4 bolts to a shared ledge with Sweet Surprise

climbs.name: "A" Crack
climbs.fa: Tom McMillan, Chuck Hill, Dave Insley

content.description: Difficult start on sharp edges and thin feet.  There are a few options to clip bolts from Blow Fly's Last Ride so I'm unsure of the original rating of 5.10X.  That being typed...we toproped the route but it never appeared runout or with decking potential.  Another edging fest and worthy of a climb whether it is lead, followed or TR'd.
content.location: Find the piton and you have found the route.  Immediately right of the start of Blow Fly's Last Ride.

climbs.name: Blow Fly's Last Ride
climbs.fa: Chuck Hill, Tom McMillan, Dave Insley, Dave Gunn

content.description: Thin and edgy and with some decent spacing between bolts highlight this three-star classic.  For the smearing and edging aficionado prepare to wait in line for a ride on a blow fly.  A somewhat committing start on a nice rail that eventually leads to the high first bolt marks the start of this route.  A fall in the beginning will probably end your day of climbing, a fall while on the traversing nature of the route may also warrant a change of undergarments.
content.location: The start is just around the corner of Young Monkeys.  Locate handrail that accepts a #.3 or #.4 cam.  You can see five of the seven bolts from the start.

content.description: This is the areas tallest crags and a must stop if you are only here for one day.  The east-facing outcrop gets after-noon shade, a must in the on those hot days.
